column5: Has anyone fished Shoal since Tim, Dave, and Katherine have sold the lodge? Tim and family ran a great camp. I don't know if Tim sold the business and got out of running a camp altogether. If so, their timing was close to perfect with the pandemic. If you've been at camp with the new ownership, how was it? Definitely a unique fishery with some really good fishing. Thanks in advance for sharing your experiences.

Wondering the same about Shoal. Was an awesome fishery in the 2005 to 2015 range. Crazy fishing. Remember the days when the wiley point and totem resort folks would offer a $500 a day - remote trip to Shoal and there guests would troll for pike lol. I have not made it back since the change in ownership / pandemic. Also wondering the same thing about Tim and his family. Tim was a great guySent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Are there walleyes in shoal lake??
there are lots of walleyes in shoal, however you can not fish for them. very good bass lake , or northern,, and will catch lots of incedental walleye. dont get caught bringing them in the boat tho
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6703825]Are there walleyes in shoal lake??[/QUOTEPlenty but you just can not fish for them
Realize that shoal is a walleye sanctuary and you cannot fish for them. Period. Hoping someone will be able to respond in regard to the lodge itself and potential new owners.
